definition.name: NXcorrector_cs
definition.doc:
Corrector for spherical aberrations in an electron microscope.
Different vendors use a different naming scheme for the spherical aberration factors. It is the users responsibility to map to the best matching values.
The spherical aberration corrector is a component in modern TEMs that is controlled via instructing the microscope to achieve set point values. Users can use the base class as a group below which eventually the individual lenses and components of the corrector can be specified; however usually this is not necessary, most often not even possible because of vendor-specific undisclosed details. In the case of Nion Co. microscopes the coefficients of the corrector can be retrieved, which is why currently the Nion convention for the coefficients is used.
